companion.name: Badger
companion.support: Your badger digs around your foe's position, interfering with its footing. Until the start of your next turn, if you hit and deal damage to a creature your badger threatens, the target can't use a Step action (unless it can Step through difficult terrain) until it moves from its current position.

maneuver.name: Badger Rage
maneuver.requirements: The badger isn't fatigued or raging.
entries: The badger enters a state of pure rage that lasts for 1 minute, until there are no enemies it can perceive, or until it falls unconscious, whichever comes first. It can't voluntarily stop raging. While raging, the badger is affected in the following ways.

items: It deals 4 additional damage with its bite attacks and 2 additional damage with its claw attacks.
It takes a –1 penalty to AC
It can't use actions that have the concentrate trait unless they also have the rage trait. The animal companion can Seek even while raging.

entries: After it has stopped raging, it can't use Badger Rage again for 1 minute.

fluff.name: Badger
entries: Your companion is a badger, wolverine, or other big mustelid.

abilities.name: Breath Weapon
entries: The faerie dragon breathes euphoric  gas in a 10-foot cone. Each creature in the area must  attempt a Fortitude save against your class DC or spell  DC, whichever is higher. A creature that fails its save is  {@condition stupefied||stupefied 2} and {@condition slowed||slowed 1} for {@dice 1d4} rounds; on a critical failure,  the duration is 1 minute.

fluff.name: Faerie Dragon
entries: These tiny, mischievous dragons make natural allies for  benevolent or capricious characters.

familiarAbility.name: Amphibious
entries: It gains a swim Speed of 25 feet (or Speed of 25 feet if it already has a swim Speed).

familiarAbility.name: Burrower
entries: It gains a burrow Speed of 5 feet, allowing it to dig Tiny holes.

familiarAbility.name: Climber
entries: It gains a climb Speed of 25 feet.

familiarAbility.name: Damage Avoidance
entries: Choose one type of save. It takes no damage when it succeeds at that type of save; this doesn't prevent effects other than damage.

familiarAbility.name: Darkvision
entries: It gains {@ability darkvision}.

familiarAbility.name: Fast Movement
entries: Increase one of the familiar's Speeds from 25 feet to 40 feet.

familiarAbility.name: Flier
entries: It gains a fly Speed of 25 feet.

familiarAbility.name: Kinspeech
entries: It can understand and speak with animals of the same species. To select this, your familiar must be an animal, it must have the speech ability, and you must be at least 6th level.

familiarAbility.name: Lab Assistant
entries: It can use your Quick Alchemy action. You must have Quick Alchemy, and your familiar must be in your space. This has the same cost and requirement as if you used it. It must have the manual dexterity ability to select this.

familiarAbility.name: Manual Dexterity
entries: It can use up to two of its limbs as if they were hands to use manipulate actions.

familiarAbility.name: Scent
entries: It gains scent (imprecise, 30 feet).

familiarAbility.name: Speech
entries: It understands and speaks a language you know.

familiarAbility.name: Cantrip Connection
entries: You can prepare an additional cantrip, or if you have a repertoire, instead designate a cantrip to add to your repertoire every time you select this ability; you can retrain it but canâ€™t otherwise change it. You must be able to prepare cantrips or add them to your repertoire to select this.

familiarAbility.name: Extra Reagents
entries: Your familiar grows extra infused reagents on or in its body. You gain an additional batch of infused reagents. You must have the infused reagents ability to select this ability.

familiarAbility.name: Familiar Focus
entries: Once per day, your familiar can use 2 actions with the concentrate trait to regain 1 Focus Point, up to your usual maximum You must have a focus pool to select this.

familiarAbility.name: Lifelink
entries: If your familiar would be reduced to 0 HP by damage, as a reaction with the concentrate trait, you can take the damage. If you do, you take all the damage and your familiar takes none. However, if special effects when a hit damages your familiar (such as snake venom) still apply to your familiar.

familiarAbility.name: Spell Battery
entries: You gain one additional spell slot at least 3 levels lower than your highest-level spell slot; you must be able to cast 4th-level spells using spell slots to select this master ability.

familiarAbility.name: Spell Delivery
entries: If your familiar is in your space, you can cast a spell with a range of touch, transfer its power to your familiar, and command the familiar to deliver the spell. If you do, the familiar uses its 2 actions for the round to move to a target of your choice and touch that target. If it doesn't reach the target to touch it this turn, the spell has no effect.
